original: ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: Why is it said?

original: l'u la san sbyar bas l'u gnyis pa byas te /
analyzed: l'u la san sbyar bas l'u gnyis pa byas te /
translated: When it is combined with lulasana, the second lu is made.

original: l'u aa dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: l'u aa dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no lu that possesses a.

original: l'u l'u sha ti'o //
analyzed: l'u l'u sha ti'o //
translated: Lulashati.

original: sru la sogs pa 'di rnams ni thams cad kyang 'gro ba'i don to //
analyzed: sru la sogs pa 'di rnams ni thams cad kyang 'gro ba'i don to //
translated: All of these, such as sru, are for the sake of going.

original: de rnams aa bhy'a sa'i au gang yin pa de'i pha rol na aantastha aa dang ldan pa dang / san\ yod na ai 'byung bar yang gsungs te /
analyzed: de rnams aa bhy'a sa'i au gang yin pa de'i pha rol na aantastha aa dang ldan pa dang / san\ yod na ai 'byung bar yang gsungs te /
translated: After the u of abhyasa, there is anantasta a, and when there is san, i arises.

original: srul ain\ sbyar nas /
analyzed: srul ain\ sbyar nas /
translated: When sru is combined with in,

original: san\ sbyar bas /
analyzed: san\ sbyar bas /
translated: when san is combined,

original: sru gnyis pa byas /
analyzed: sru gnyis pa byas /
translated: the second sru is made.

original: sru gong mas ai thob /
analyzed: sru gong mas ai thob /
translated: The upper sru obtains i.

original: sru 'gog mas su aa b'a dang ai sbyar bas /
analyzed: sru 'gog mas su aa b'a dang ai sbyar bas /
translated: The lower sru combines su and i,

original: gu na ae aa ya /
analyzed: gu na ae aa ya /
translated: making gunae a.

original: aa dang gi sbyar bas sha thob /
analyzed: aa dang gi sbyar bas sha thob /
translated: When a is combined with gi, sha is obtained.

original: sri sra wa yisha ti'o ;
analyzed: sri sra wa yisha ti'o ;
translated: Srisravayishto.

original: / phyogs gcig la ai thob pa'o //
analyzed: / phyogs gcig la ai thob pa'o //
translated: I is obtained for one part.

original: sru la ain dang san\ sbyar ba sogs gong bzhin //
analyzed: sru la ain dang san\ sbyar ba sogs gong bzhin //
translated: The affix iṇa is added to the root su, and so on, as above.

original: phyogs gcig la ai ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig la ai ma thob pa'o //
translated: The i is not obtained in one part.

original: su sra la wa yisha ta'o //
analyzed: su sra la wa yisha ta'o //
translated: The affix iṣṭā is added to the root surasa.

original: p'u la ain\ la sogs pa sbyar ba gong ma bzhin /
analyzed: p'u la ain\ la sogs pa sbyar ba gong ma bzhin /
translated: The affix iṇa is added to the root pū, and so on, as above.

original: phyogs gcig la ai ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig la ai ma thob pa'o //
translated: The i is not obtained in one part.

original: gu na shtse kr'i ai te /
analyzed: gu na shtse kr'i ai te /
translated: Gunāścekriyate.

original: tse kr'i yi ta pha rol na yod na aa bhyas gu nar 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: tse kr'i yi ta pha rol na yod na aa bhyas gu nar 'byung ba ste /
translated: If there is a ce on the other side of kri, it becomes guṇa by the abhyāsa rule.

original: tsi la ai sbyar bas tsi gnyis pa byas na /
analyzed: tsi la ai sbyar bas tsi gnyis pa byas na /
translated: When the i is added to ci, the second ci is made.

original: myan tra nam gyi mdos tsi 'og ma bsring /
analyzed: myan tra nam gyi mdos tsi 'og ma bsring /
translated: When the sūtra nam of myantra is applied, the lower ci is lengthened.

original: mdo 'dis gong ma'i ai aer 'phel //
analyzed: mdo 'dis gong ma'i ai aer 'phel //
translated: By this sūtra, the upper i becomes ai.

original: tsa ts'i ya te'o //
analyzed: tsa ts'i ya te'o //
translated: Cacīyate.

original: n'i la ya sbyar bas gong bzhin /
analyzed: n'i la ya sbyar bas gong bzhin /
translated: The affix iṇa is added to the root ni, as above.

original: ne n'i ya te'o //
analyzed: ne n'i ya te'o //
translated: Neciyate.

original: d'irgha n'a g'a m'anta sya /
analyzed: d'irgha n'a g'a m'anta sya /
translated: Dīrgha nāgamāntasya.

original: aa bhya sa gang la thob pa'i mtha' can med pa de sring ba ste /
analyzed: aa bhya sa gang la thob pa'i mtha' can med pa de sring ba ste /
translated: That which ends with the affix is lengthened by the abhyāsa rule.

original: pa tsa la ya sbyar bas gong du pa gnyis pa byas te bsrings pa'o //
analyzed: pa tsa la ya sbyar bas gong du pa gnyis pa byas te bsrings pa'o //
translated: The affix iṇa is added to the root pac, and the second pa is made and lengthened as above.

original: p'a pa tsya te'o /
analyzed: p'a pa tsya te'o /
translated: Pāpacīyate.

original: // / wanytsa sram si bham si bham /
analyzed: // / wanytsa sram si bham si bham /
translated: Vyañjanam sikhā bhansikhā.

original: si ka si pa ti pa di skand'a mando ni /
analyzed: si ka si pa ti pa di skand'a mando ni /
translated: Sakaṭapāṭapāṭaskandāmandonī.

original: banytsu ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: banytsu ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: Bhyañjanam means going.

original: sransu dang dhvansu bhransu ni zhig pa'o //
analyzed: sransu dang dhvansu bhransu ni zhig pa'o //
translated: Sraṃsu, dhraṃsu, bhraṃsu mean to be destroyed.

original: kas ni 'gro ba'o //🔽pi tli yang 'gro ba'o//
analyzed: kas ni 'gro ba'o // pi tli yang 'gro ba'o//
translated: Ka means to go.🔽 Pit means to go.

original: pa d'a yang 'gro b'o //
analyzed: pa d'a yang 'gro b'o //
translated: Pada also means to go.

original: skan der ni skam pa'o //
analyzed: skan der ni skam pa'o //
translated: Skand means to dry up.

original: de rnams kyi dh'a tu'i pha rol na tse kr'i yi ta yod na aa bhya sa la ni thob pa 'byung ba ste /🔽banytsi la ya sbyar bas wa gnyis pa byas nas phyi /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dh'a tu'i pha rol na tse kr'i yi ta yod na aa bhya sa la ni thob pa 'byung ba ste / banytsi la ya sbyar bas wa gnyis pa byas nas phyi /
translated: In the dhatu of those, if there is cekerita, then abhyasa means to obtain.

original: ni thob ya dang tsa sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: ni thob ya dang tsa sbyar ba'o //
translated: By combining with bhyañjanam, the second va is made, and the final is obtained.🔽 Ya and ca are combined.

original: wa n'i wa tsya ke'o //
analyzed: wa n'i wa tsya ke'o //
translated: Va means to say.

original: sran si la ya sbyar ba gong bzhin /🔽sa ni @49a * //
analyzed: sran si la ya sbyar ba gong bzhin / sa ni @49a * //
translated: By combining with sraṃsu, as before,

original: sra sya te'o //
analyzed: sra sya te'o //
translated: sa means to be hard.

original: dhvan si la ya sbyar bas gong bzhin /
analyzed: dhvan si la ya sbyar bas gong bzhin /
translated: By combining with dhraṃsu, as before,

original: da n'i dhva sya te'o //
analyzed: da n'i dhva sya te'o //
translated: da means to be dry.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to the others.🔽 Ato 'ntonausvaroranusāsakaṃtaḥ syāt.

original: aa tonto nu sv'a ro ra nu sa si k'a nta sya /
analyzed: aa tonto nu sv'a ro ra nu sa si k'a nta sya /
translated: 🔽Ato 'ntonausvaroranusāsakaṃtaḥ syāt means from that, the final nasal and svarita are to be combined with the preceding vowel.

original: gang aa nu na si k'i mtha' can gyi dh'a tu'i aa bhya s'i a'i mtha' can la rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs thob par 'gyur ba ste /🔽tse kr'i'i mtha' pha rol na yod par 'gyur n'o //🔽ya ma la ya sbyar bas /🔽gong du ya ma gnyis pa byas /

translated: The vowel that is obtained by the addition of the anusvāra to the dhātu ending in an, and the vowel that is obtained by the addition of the anusvāra to the abhyāsa ending in i,🔽are on the other side of the c, k, and g.🔽When the two yamas are combined,🔽the two yamas above are made.

original: dan sha ni mthus 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: dan sha ni mthus 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Dhana means to harm by force.

original: bhany dzo ni kun du 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: bhany dzo ni kun du 'joms pa'o //
translated: Bhanja means to destroy completely.

original: pa sa ni kun du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: pa sa ni kun du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Pasa means to go everywhere.

original: dza y'a d'i n'anytsa /
analyzed: dza y'a d'i n'anytsa /
translated: Jaya means to conquer.

original: dza pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi bhya sa'i pha rol na /
analyzed: dza pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi bhya sa'i pha rol na /
translated: After those, such as ja, the sibilants get the following vowels.

original: tse kr'i ta yod na rjes su 'jug p'i dbyangs thob bo //
analyzed: tse kr'i ta yod na rjes su 'jug p'i dbyangs thob bo //
translated: If there is a c in the end, the following vowel is obtained.

original: dza pa la ya sbyar bas dza pa gnyis pa byas te ;
analyzed: dza pa la ya sbyar bas dza pa gnyis pa byas te ;
translated: By joining ja and pa, the second ja is made.

original: pa phyi / dza la thig le'o //
analyzed: pa phyi / dza la thig le'o //
translated: The anusvara is on the ja.

original: dzam dza pya te'o //
analyzed: dzam dza pya te'o //
translated: Jam is ja and pya.

original: dza bha la ya sbyar bas gong bzhin /
analyzed: dza bha la ya sbyar bas gong bzhin /
translated: By joining ja and bhaya, as above,

original: dzam dza bhya te'o //
analyzed: dzam dza bhya te'o //
translated: jam is ja and bhyata.

original: dan sha la sbyar bas na phyi /
analyzed: dan sha la sbyar bas na phyi /
translated: By joining dhana, as above,

original: gong du da gnyis pa byas /
analyzed: gong du da gnyis pa byas /
translated: the second da is made.

original: gong bzhin / dam da shya te'o //
analyzed: gong bzhin / dam da shya te'o //
translated: Dam is da and syata.

original: bhanydza la ya sbyar bas gong bzhin /
analyzed: bhanydza la ya sbyar bas gong bzhin /
translated: By joining bhanja, as above,

original: bam bha dzya te'o //
analyzed: bam bha dzya te'o //
translated: bam is bhanjya.

original: pa sa pa la ya sbyar bas gong bzhin /
analyzed: pa sa pa la ya sbyar bas gong bzhin /
translated: By joining pasa, as above,

original: pam pa sya te'o //
analyzed: pam pa sya te'o //
translated: pam is pasya.

original: tsa ra pha lo du tstsa pa ra sy'a sya /
analyzed: tsa ra pha lo du tstsa pa ra sy'a sya /
translated: Caraphaloducacaparasyā.

original: tsa ra ni 'gro ba'i don to //
analyzed: tsa ra ni 'gro ba'i don to //
translated: Cara means the meaning of going.

original: pha la ni nges par rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: pha la ni nges par rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Phala means to complete definitively.

original: de rnams kyi aa bhya sa la rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs thob par gyur ba ste pha rol gyi aa la au yang gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi aa bhya sa la rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs thob par gyur ba ste pha rol gyi aa la au yang gzhag pa ste /
translated: The vowels that follow those are obtained, and the u of the other a is also placed.

original: tse kr'i yi ta pha rol na yod na'o //
analyzed: tse kr'i yi ta pha rol na yod na'o //
translated: If there is a c in the other,

original: tsa ra la ya sbyar bas gong du tsa gnyis pa byas /
analyzed: tsa ra la ya sbyar bas gong du tsa gnyis pa byas /
translated: the c of the first is changed to a double c.

original: mdo 'dis thig le thob pa dang / tsa 'og mas au thob /
analyzed: mdo 'dis thig le thob pa dang / tsa 'og mas au thob /
translated: By this rule, the anusvara is obtained, and the lower c obtains the u.

original: mdos bsrings pa'o //
analyzed: mdos bsrings pa'o //
translated: The rule is extended.

original: tsam tsurya te'o //
analyzed: tsam tsurya te'o //
translated: The c is changed to a cy.
